https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A discipline focused on the quantitative measurements of the mineralogy, chemistry, morphology and microstructures of minerals and mineral assemblages using a range of analytical techniques (e.g. modal analysis, X-ray diffractometry, infrared and Raman spectroscopy, refractometry, spectral mapping, etc.). Specifically, quantitative mineral methodologies are utilized to measure and/or constrain mineral abundances, as well as to provide mineral grade and texture information for geological and mineral processing applications.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition from:
Keulen, N, Malkki, SN and Graham, S 2020, Automated Quantitative Mineralogy Applied to Metamorphic Rocks, in Applications of SEM Automated Mineralogy: From Ore Deposits over Processing to Secondary Resource Characterization), edited by B Schulz: Minerals, v.10(1), 47, doi:10.3390/min10010047.
